title: 114_s820
content: The "Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2015" enhances the child and dependent care tax credit. The Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2015 modifies the applicable percentage for employment-related expenses based on the taxpayer's adjusted gross income. The Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2015 adjusts the percentage reduction in the credit based on the taxpayer's income and increases the dollar limit on the creditable amount for qualifying individuals. The Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2015 increases the dollar limit for qualifying individuals with children under 5 years old to $9,000 for one child and $12,000 for two or more children. Additionally, there is an inflation adjustment for dollar amounts in subsections (A) and (B) of subsection (a)(2) and subsection (c) after 2016. The Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2015 increases dollar limits for qualifying individuals with children under 5 years old. The dollar amounts in subsections (A) and (B) of subsection (a)(2) and subsection (c) are adjusted annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. Additionally, the credit is made refundable under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2015 increases dollar limits for qualifying individuals with children under 5 years old and adjusts dollar amounts annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. The credit is made refundable under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Section 36C is moved to a new location in the Code and technical amendments are made to various sections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change references from section 21 to section 36C in various subsections and paragraphs. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change references to section 21 to section 36C in different sections and paragraphs. This includes amending section 6213(g)(2)(L) and section 1324(b)(2) of title 31, United States Code. Additionally, the table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is updated to include section 36C. The amendment changes references from section 21 to section 36C in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The effective date for these amendments is for taxable years starting after December 31, 2015.
